intro: Sphaerostephanos cartilagidens, commonly known as the cartilage-structured star flower, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its distinctive, spherical inflorescence. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant features delicate, white flowers that bloom in a star-like pattern, surrounded by a fleshy, cartilage-like structure that provides support. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, resembling those of other members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
